required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CASTRO-B - Study on CRP Apheresis in STROke Patients in Berlin
clinical_study.official_title: Selective Depletion of C-reactive Protein (CRP) With Therapeutic Apheresis (CRP Apheresis) in Stroke

collaborator.agency: NeuroCure Clinical Research Center, Charite, Berlin
Department of Nephrology and Internal Intensive Care Medicine, Charite, Berlin

brief_summary.textblock: This study explores the use of CRP level reduction in patients after suffering from acute ischemic stroke. Using selective CRP-apheresis, the investigators aim to reduce the secondary inflammatory tissue damage in the course of infarction maturation using infarction growth in MRI as the primary outcome as a surrogate.

detailed_description.textblock: C-reactive protein (CRP) is an acute-phase protein binding to phosphocholine, thereby marking damaged tissue. This in turn activates the complement system and the cellular immune system engaging the unspecific immune system in an inflammatory tissue-degrading reaction. Such a pattern is observed in ischemic stroke, and elevated CRP levels can be measured in stroke survivors' sera. Several observational studies reproduced higher CRP levels with negative outcome in stroke. In another vascular model disease, myocardial infarction, selective CRP apheresis reduced infarct size in humans. The investigators therefore designed this pilot study to explore the effects of selective CRP reduction in ischemic stroke patients.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparisons will be drawn from historic controls from previous observational stroke studies

primary_outcome.description: Infarct growth measured via DWI-FLAIR volume change

secondary_outcome.description: Infarct growth measured via diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI)-FLAIR volume change
National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score - ranging from 0-42 - higher values represent a worse outcome
Modified ranking scale (mRS) score - ranging from 0-6 with higher scores signifying worse outcome no subscales
Barthel Index (BI) - ranging from 0-100 with higher scores signifying better outcome; no subscales
Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) - ranging from 0-30 with higher scores signifying better outcome; no subscales

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life after Stroke via Stroke Impact Scale (SIS)
secondary_outcome.description: Stroke Impact Scale - Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) - measures different aspects of the overall impact of stroke on the patients' health and quality of life with different subscales addressing different domains: physical problems memory and thinking mood and emotions communication daily activities mobility motor impairment hand participation overall recovery higher values represent better outcome
Composite frequency of Complications within the time frame

arm_group.description: CRP apheresis by means of selective apheresis using the "PentraSorb"-CRP adsorber

intervention.description: selective CRP apheresis by use of the "PentraSorb"-CRP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 - 85 years
- Informed consent signed by patient
- Patients with acute ischemic stroke in the Arteria cerebri media (MCA) territory within 36 hours of event
- Acute MRI with evidence of infarction
- NIHSS ≥ 4
- CRP > 5 mg/l
Exclusion Criteria:
- Withdrawal of consent
- Systolic blood pressure <100 mmHg before the apheresis
- Blood pressure relevant extra- and intracranial stenoses (NASCET 70)
- Apheresis contraindication
- Participation in other interventional studies
